title: Asthma Children
content:
It is useful to know your child's triggers. Use a [symptom diary](https://healthify.nz/tools/s/symptom-diary) to keep a record of possible triggers.
####  Could my child have asthma? 
You should see your healthcare provider and ask about asthma if your child:
  * wheezes and coughs with a cold (virus)
  * wheezes and coughs after exercise
  * wheezes and coughs during the night
  * can't keep up when they're running around with children of the same age
  * says they are out of breath or breathless
  * complains they feel tired or asks you to carry them (depending on their age) when you go for a walk
  * doesn't run around as much as other children of the same age.


These are some of the symptoms of asthma in children, but they may also be due to other less common conditions. Talk to your healthcare provider about them.
####  What if my child does have asthma? 
#### Asthma medicines
Read about [different types of asthma medicines.](https://healthify.nz/medicines-a-z/a/asthma-medication)
#### Online learning tool
You can use the[Asthma + Respiratory Foundation NZ's online learning tool(external link)](https://learnaboutlungs.asthmaandrespiratory.org.nz/ "Open external link") to learn more about how you can help children with asthma stay fit, healthy and happy.
[![Screenshot of Asthma + Respiratory Foundation interactive resource](https://www.kidshealth.org.nz/sites/kidshealth/files/images/Asthma%20interactive%20resource%20small.png)(external link)](https://learnaboutlungs.asthmaandrespiratory.org.nz/ "Open external link")
#### Booklets to download
You can read the following translated booklets alongside the online learning tool above.

#### Videos to watch
You can also watch some videos from KidsHealth NZ about [managing asthma in children and young people(external link)](https://www.kidshealth.org.nz/managing-asthma-children-young-people "Open external link").
####  How do I treat my child's asthma attack? (+ APPS) 
Find out about [mild, moderate and severe asthma attacks and what to do if your child has one(external link)](https://www.kidshealth.org.nz/asthma-attacks-children "Open external link"), on KidsHealth NZ.
There also some [asthma apps](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/a/asthma-first-aid) that have been reviewed by Healthify.   
  

####  ![Young boy using inhaler with spacer](https://healthify.nz/assets/Health-A-Z/Respiratory/Boy-using-spacer-with-inhaler-ARFNZ-950x690__ResizedImageWzYwMCw0MzZd.png)
_Image credit:[Asthma and Respiratory Foundation NZ(external link)](https://www.asthmafoundation.org.nz/ "Open external link")_
#### Apps reviewed by Healthify
You may find it useful to look at some [asthma apps](https://healthify.nz/apps/a/asthma-apps).
####  Will my child grow out of asthma? 
Asthma is a long-term condition.
